simulated_ratings.title: Vanilla Sky (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: I dig the reality-bending romance angle, even if it’s a bit messy, and the sci-fi mystery vibe hits my sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Inception (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Big-brain heist with slick action and layers on layers is exactly my kind of ride.

simulated_ratings.title: Thirteenth Floor, The (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cool simulation twist and noir mood, not as punchy as the genre’s best but still very satisfying.

simulated_ratings.title: Edge of Tomorrow (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Smart time-loop action with great momentum and witty beats makes it a blast.

simulated_ratings.title: Messenger: The Story of Joan of Arc, The (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: I appreciate the epic ambition and grit, though the intensity outpaces my emotional connection at times.

simulated_ratings.title: Berserk: The Golden Age Arc 2 - The Battle for Doldrey (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Brutal, operatic fantasy warfare scratches the Mononoke-style itch, just darker and bleaker.

simulated_ratings.title: Contact (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Thoughtful, wonder-driven sci-fi with heart is right up my alley even without big explosions.

simulated_ratings.title: Gattaca (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Elegant, tense, and heartfelt sci-fi about identity and ambition really resonates with me.

simulated_ratings.title: Stargate (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Pulp adventure plus ancient-alien sci-fi is exactly the kind of fun I devour.

simulated_ratings.title: Abyss, The (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Deep-sea suspense mixed with awe and empathy presses all my Cameron-era sci-fi buttons.

simulated_ratings.title: Interstellar (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Majestic space adventure with big feelings and brainy stakes is my catnip.

simulated_ratings.title: Oblivion (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sleek, moody mystery sci-fi works for me even if the story beats feel familiar.

simulated_ratings.title: Labyrinth (1986)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Whimsical quest vibes, creature effects, and fantasy heart make for delightful comfort viewing.

simulated_ratings.title: Matrix, The (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mind-blowing concept married to kinetic action is an instant favorite for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Total Eclipse (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Intense, artsy romance feels a bit too dour for my tastes despite strong performances.

simulated_ratings.title: Last Samurai, The (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Handsome, honorable epic with stirring battles and cultural clash hits solidly for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Pitch Black (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lean, creature-in-the-dark thrills and antihero edge make for a tense, fun watch.

simulated_ratings.title: Constantine (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody occult action with stylish world-building scratches my Hellboy-adjacent itch.

simulated_ratings.title: Four Feathers, The (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Old-school adventure melodrama lands fine, though it doesn’t quite soar for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Pandorum (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grimy space-horror mystery keeps me engaged even if it gets a bit chaotic and bleak.

simulated_ratings.title: Willow (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic hero’s journey fantasy with charm and adventure is right in my wheelhouse.

simulated_ratings.title: Wisdom (1986)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Offbeat outlaw romance-crime idea intrigues me but the execution feels uneven.

simulated_ratings.title: Event Horizon (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Creepy, relentless space terror is compelling, though the horror edges past my comfort zone.

simulated_ratings.title: Dredd (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tight, brutal sci-fi siege with cool gadgets and momentum hits the spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Source Code (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever, propulsive time-loop thriller with heart is exactly my jam.

simulated_ratings.title: Joe Versus the Volcano (1990)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quirky rom-com adventure is charming in parts but a bit too oddball for me overall.

simulated_ratings.title: Minority Report (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: High-concept chase thriller with slick world-building and twists is right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: Wreck-It Ralph (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweet, imaginative arcade-world adventure balances humor and heart beautifully.

simulated_ratings.title: Sneakers (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Breezy caper energy, smart tech puzzles, and a fun ensemble make this very enjoyable.

simulated_ratings.title: Doctor Who: A Christmas Carol (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Whimsical sci-fi holiday morality tale is pleasant and inventive if not essential for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Beaches (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest friendship melodrama gets me occasionally, but it’s not really my lane.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Live at The Comedy Store (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tight, funny, and observant enough to keep me laughing throughout.

simulated_ratings.title: Jean de Florette (1986)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Beautifully cruel slow-burn drama I admire more than I love.

simulated_ratings.title: Thousand Acres, A (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Heavy family tragedy lands unevenly for me despite the ambition.

simulated_ratings.title: Jeff Dunham: Arguing with Myself (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Broad, gimmicky shtick wears thin fast for my comedy tastes.

simulated_ratings.title: Blackfish (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Powerful and upsetting advocacy doc that sticks with me.

simulated_ratings.title: Religulous (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Snarky, provocative takedown that's witty in parts but a bit smug.

simulated_ratings.title: Sicko (2007)

simulated_ratings.title: The Pagan (1929)

simulated_ratings.title: Little Ghost (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Light, TV-level fantasy that’s cute but forgettable for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Titanic (1953)

simulated_ratings.title: Cure, The (1995)

simulated_ratings.title: Fahrenheit 9/11 (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Angry and persuasive in stretches, but the grandstanding dulls the punch.

simulated_ratings.title: A Christmas Proposal (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cozy, formula TV romance that goes down easy and leaves no mark.

simulated_ratings.title: Eat Pray Love (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy self-discovery journey with moments I enjoy but overall too navel-gazey for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Born Rich (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Interesting peek behind the curtain without quite digging deep enough.

simulated_ratings.title: Maqbool (2003)

simulated_ratings.title: Hachiko: A Dog's Story (a.k.a. Hachi: A Dog's Tale) (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tender, tear-jerker loyalty tale that lands emotionally without much fuss.

simulated_ratings.title: White Chicks (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Broad, silly undercover shenanigans mostly miss my funny bone.

simulated_ratings.title: Like Water for Chocolate (Como agua para chocolate) (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sensual, magical-realism romance that flavors the melodrama nicely for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Walk on the Moon, A (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Solid period affair drama with a vibe I respect more than I feel.

simulated_ratings.title: In the Bleak Midwinter (1995)

simulated_ratings.title: Band Baaja Baaraat (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lively rom-com energy and workplace sparks make for a fun ride.

simulated_ratings.title: Rang Birangi (1983)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Light, witty farce that keeps the smiles coming even if it’s slight.

simulated_ratings.title: Gone Are the Days! (1963)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stagey social drama that’s interesting historically but only mildly engaging.

simulated_ratings.title: Jeepers Creepers 2 (2003)

simulated_ratings.title: Under the Skin (2013)

simulated_ratings.title: Scream 3 (2000)

simulated_ratings.title: Final Destination, The (Final Destination 4) (Final Destination in 3-D, The) (2009)
